I mean, I can see that you're quite distressed by it, but do you ever get really down about this? And when do you think you last felt yourself? And has your mood ever been so low that you felt like you just couldn't carry on with your job or with your life or with your normal things as they were going on? Yeah, okay. And who do you live with at home? Who do you live with at home? And how much alcohol do you have in an average week, do you think? Okay, so how much would you guess? Okay, do you smoke or take any other drugs or anything? Okay. And have you done anything yourself to help? Have you talked to anyone, talked to any counsellors, done any online, looked online at all? Any ways to help them? Okay. Okay. And wouldn't you be happy to have some one-to-one therapy? Okay. I mean, what we would suggest in the first instance is to start, you can self-refer via the NHS for what we call like talking therapy, which is type of behavioural therapy where they can really look at your situation, how you're reacting to what's provoking the anxiety and what you can do to try and overcome that. So I can send you the link for that. In the meantime, so it can be a bit of a wait. There are some online resources that are really helpful. Put the details on there and you can get on with them straight away and try and work through them as well. And if you're feeling like it's not helping at all or your anxiety is getting worse to the point where you can't cope with work or you can't just do your normal things day to day, then it's important for you to give us a call back and just discuss that further. I mean some people with anxiety they do need to take medication to control that but that's not something that we suggest in the first instance and I'll put some more information on your notes about helping with your sleep patterns and things like that. In terms of the palpitations, it is most likely to be associated with anxiety but it's probably worth having a couple of basic blood tests just to make sure that there's not something triggering that off and then arranging a GP follow-up a week after you've had the test so we can just go through the results with you. So if you call the support line you can arrange the to have the blood test done. Okay all right take care. Sorry, right over.
